question.content: The following data points represent the weight (in kilograms) of each dog in the Ridgeway Dog Show.  $\qquad 3, 2, 16, 4, 26, 8, 6, 3$  **How many kilograms did the lightest dog weigh?**    $\text{ kg}$

hints.content: The lightest dog weighed $2\text{ kg}$.

question.content: The following table shows the yearly salaries for each of the cheerleading coaches in Dakota County.  Coach | Yearly salary (in thousands of dollars) - | :-: | Mr. Boone | $41$ Mrs. Ingrid | $38$  Mr. Jackson |  $36$  Ms. Sites | $57$ Ms. Morty| $42$ Ms. Sawyer| $37$  **What is the lowest yearly salary for a cheerleading coach?**   thousand dollars

hints.content: Coach | Yearly salary (in thousands of dollars) - | :-: | Mr. Boone | $41$ Mrs. Ingrid | $38$  Mr. Jackson |  $\green{\large36}$  Ms. Sites | $57$ Ms. Morty| $42$ Ms. Sawyer| $37$
The lowest yearly salary for a cheerleading coach is $36$ thousand dollars.

question.content: **What was the fewest gold coins that a scavenger collected?**    gold coins

hints.content: [[☃ image 2]]
The fewest  gold coins that a scavenger collected was $5$.

question.content: The following table shows the number of points scored last  game by each player on the Dragons basketball team.   Player | Isabella | Rafaela | Beatriz | Julia | Sarah - | :-:| :-:| :-:| :-:| :-: **Points scored** | $5$ | $9$ | $10$ | $6$| $10$  **What was the minimum number of points scored by a player?**   points

hints.content: Player | Isabella | Rafaela | Beatriz | Julia | Sarah - | :-:| :-:| :-:| :-:| :-: **Points scored** | $\green{\large5}$ | $9$ | $10$ | $6$| $10$
The minimum number of points scored by a player  was $5$.

hints.content: $\qquad \green{\large0}, \green{\large0}, 2, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 8, 3, \green{\large0}, \green{\large0}$

question.content: **What was the fewest baskets a student made?**   baskets

hints.content: [[☃ image 2]]
Reynaldo made $2 \times 3 = 6$ baskets.
The fewest baskets a student made was $6$.

question.content: Justin did push-ups every day this week. He did $8$ push-ups on Monday, $14$ push-ups on Tuesday, $18$ push-ups on Wednesday, $6$ push-ups on Thursday,  $8$ push-ups on Friday, $9$ push-ups on Saturday, and $12$ push-ups on Sunday.  **What was the maximum number of push-ups that Justin did in a day this week?**  $\qquad$  push-ups

hints.content: Justin did $\green{18}$ push-ups on Wednesday.
The maximum number of push-ups that Justin did in a day  this week was $18$.

question.content: The following data points represent the number of chocolate chips in each of the cookies that Cam bought.  $\qquad 5, 6, 3, 9, 6$  **What was the maximum number of chocolate chips in a cookie?**    chocolate chips

hints.content: $\qquad 5, 6, 3, \green{\large9}, 6$
The maximum number of chocolate chips in a cookie was $9$.

question.content: Jose tracks how many times he gets fast food each month. He got fast food $12$ times in January, $10$ times in February, $15$ times in March, $4$ times in April, and $2$ times in May.  **What was the maximum number of times that Jose got fast food in a month?**    times

hints.content: Jose got fast food $\green{15}$ times during March.
The maximum number of times that Jose got fast food in a month was $15$.

question.content: Nate weighed each of his cats. He found that Betty weighed $1 \dfrac14$ kilograms, Fido weighed $2$ kilograms, Spot weighed $1 \dfrac58$ kilogram, Yogi weighed $3 \dfrac49$ kilograms, and Smarts weighed $4 \dfrac{1}{10}$ kilograms.  **What was the weight of  Nate's heaviest cat?**    $\text{ kg}$

hints.content: Smarts weighed $\green{4 \dfrac{1}{10}}\text{ kg}$.
The weight of Nate's heaviest cat was $4 \dfrac{1}{10}\text{ kg}$.

question.content: Jose tracks how many times he gets fast food each month. He got fast food $12$ times in January, $10$ times in February, $15$ times in March, $4$ times in April, and $2$ times in May.  **In how many of these months did Jose get fast food more than $11$ times?**    months

hints.content: Jose got fast food $\green{12}$ times in January and $\green{15}$ times in March.
Jose got fast food more than $11$ times in $2$ of these months.

question.content: The following data points represent the number of chocolate chips in each of the cookies that Cam bought.  $\qquad 5, 6, 3, 9, 6$  **How many of the cookies had fewer than $6$ chocolate chips in them?**    cookies

hints.content: $\qquad \green{\large5}, 6, \green{\large3}, 9, 6$
$2$ of the cookies had fewer than $6$ chocolate chips in them.

question.content: Guilherme observed the number of minutes in an hour his dormmates spent on social media sites while they were at the library. He reported his data in the following table.  Dormmate | Number of minutes on social media - | :-: | Vera | $13$ Timothy | $0$  Manueala |  $14$  Khaled | $36$ Yash| $18$ Fernanda| $16$  **How many dormmates spent less than $20$ minutes on social media sites?**    dormmates

hints.content: Dormmate | Number of minutes on social media - | :-: | Vera | $\green{\large13}$ Timothy | $\green{\large0}$  Manueala |  $\green{\large14}$  Khaled | $36$ Yash| $\green{\large18}$ Fernanda| $\green{\large16}$
$5$ dormmates spent less than $20$ minutes on social media sites.

question.content: **How many stores made more than $10$ sundaes on Monday?**    stores

hints.content: [[☃ image 2]]
Two Scoops, for example, made $4 \times 3 = 12$ sundaes on Monday.
$3$ stores made more than $10$ sundaes on Monday.

hints.content: $\qquad 6, \green{\large8}, 5,\green{\large8},2,\green{\large8},5,\green{\large8}$
The digit in the serial number of this dollar bill that occurs most often is $8$.

question.content: Below is the volume of gas  (in liters) in the tank of each race car in today's race.      **How many drivers were in today's race?**    drivers
